author: {'steamid': '76561198060791991', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 86, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 86, 'last_played': 1451760938}
review:
Местами игра [b]Kraven Manor[/b] напоминает [b]Амнезию[/b], особенно в графическом плане. И это даже приятно, всегда рад вспомнить замечательную игру от Frictional Games. К тому же в Kraven Monor [b]атмосфера[/b] все же какая-то есть. 

Вместе с тем в [b]сюжетном плане[/b] в Kraven Manor все не очень хорошо.  Сюжет несуразный, постановка сцен нелепая, головоломки ничем не примечательны. А в некоторой мере оригинальный подход к дизайну уровней положение не спасает. Но так ли важен сюжет для инди-хоррора? Может и нет, но…. 

С [b]хоррор-составляющей[/b] тоже не все гладко, так как игра совершенно не пугает. Попытку нагнать жути звуковыми эффектами засчитать можно, но лишь как попытку. А скримеры не только не пугают, но порой они даже забавны. 
Время от времени преследующий  главного героя Медный человек не дотягивает до полноценной страшилки. Самое интересное в данном персонаже – это позы, какие Медный человек принимает в перерывы, в которые на него не попадает свет фонарика главного героя.

Также игра крайне непродолжительна, пройдена мной всего за 86 минут. Может быть, я что-то пропустил, о чем свидетельствуют оставшиеся не выбитые достижения, но, увы, к тщательному исследованию игра не особо располагает.
Впрочем, малую продолжительность игры можно отнести к плюсам Kraven Manor. Конец наступил ровно тогда, когда весь возможный интерес по игре пропал. По этой причине игру и не хочется серьезно корить.

Если вам достался Kraven Manor задаром, то поиграть в принципе можно. Но покупки игра не стоит.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049321458', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 91, 'playtime_forever': 109, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 109, 'last_played': 1451738223}
review:
Хоррор, старающийся походить на квест.

Плюсы:
- Звук.
- Геймплей.
- Атмосфера.

Минусы:
- Графика. Откровенно слабая и непонятно куда уходят ресурсы.
- Продолжительность. Игра пройдена мной на самом высоком уровне сложности менее чем за два часа. С получением обеих концовок.
- Сложность. Нет ничего сложного, кроме получения хорошей концовки из-за загадки с шестерёнкой.
- Сюжет. Кто мы? Где мы? Зачем мы тут?
- Русская локализация. Ошибки, опечатки, но приведён пример о ЛСД, которого в оригинале нет.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054198329', 'num_games_owned': 2584, 'num_reviews': 93, 'playtime_forever': 67, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 67, 'last_played': 1451649055}
review:
There were a few moments that shined and in theory would have worked out great, but the execution was really off. Regardless of who made this and their experience, this is still a product that is asking for money.

For $5.99 the price is barely justified. Even though it is a little over an hour I could not bring myself to finish this. I typically enjoy short bite sized games perfect for killing a couple hours but between everything that was wrong with it I just had to put it down.

First of all the game runs bad. [i]Very[/i] bad. Graphics set to low and 0 FXAA, it struggled to stay above 24, rarely peaking at 40. This made it ridiculously janky and nigh impossible to stomach. I'll say that if it maintained a steady 60 frames a second on high (which should NOT be a problem for my specs) I would've enjoyed the setting and general look of the game alot better.

Gameplay-wise there isn't anything special. Walk around, solve "puzzles" (so minimal and straightforward they shouldn't be even called that), antagonist pop up at places/follow you/etc. This is how almost all horror games go, except that this doesn't work here all the time.

The bronze mannequin was definitely creepy at certain points and the way it behaved and interacted with you was well done. At certain points you would be stumbling around in the dark trying to keep your eyes on him (otherwise he can move and attack you). Playing on Nightmare, your flashlight runs out and darkness allows him movement. This was the strongest aspect of the game.

Other instances of interaction with the mannequin were sadly laughable and unavoidably comedic looking. At some point you walk into a sideroom in the bedroom and the door shuts behind you. You open a chest and see some pictures and then you hear a loud sound like the door opening. Turn around and the mannequin's leg is halfway in the room. It then "is dragged" out while dramatic music is playing. When you leave the room there is a shadow on the wall of the mannequin that "falls over" when you get close to it. There are many other times like this that unintentionally spark a chuckle, such as the time you spend in the wine cellar, the white medical ish room (the maze was another frustrating sequence that I gave up on when the game crashed), the attic, and the second visit to the library.

The last main point of contention would be the "examine-able" objects, like the notes, books, and pictures. Nearly all other horror games, regardless of being true independent titles or "indie" in the sense that Amnesia is indie, all have notes, books, and pictures being the main source of plot information. Typically when you interact with one you get to view the note, book, or picture, however in this, a tooltip simply pops up telling you the information. Other than this being a way of cutting corners I see no purpose for deviating from the working existent formula. What purpose does NOT showing you the paper serve? Especially with the photos. What were they thinking? Any potential impact of the story was completely wasted this way. Instead of seeing a crime scene photo you are told that this generic looking photo is that of a crime scene. This was not a budget, time, or experience issue, since many other games (even markedly WORSE ones) have the sense to not do this. This was pure laziness.

The music would be the strongest aspect of the game, but sadly this isn't saying much. I love me some dark ambient / borderline drone music but compared to what's in other games, albums, etc. either the score was either generically weak or it was terribly under-utilized. Droning sounds are not inherently creepy. If they are used well in conjunction with elements in the game such as what's going on, interactions, scenes, etc. it has the potential to be creepy, even terrifying. The quality of the music was not unique enough to hold up against it being under-utilized.

While there are some distinct positive aspects to this title, Kraven Manor severely underwhelms for the price. There are countless other games out there that have many things in common (even stuff that at first glance you'd assume to be worse than this) for $5.99 or less. I got it for free and was somewhat willing to look past the flaws but even then I came away disappointed.

review: Its a nice idea of a game, its a bit scary, it has its atmosphere but its so short, the many books, photos could use more of their potential. I give it personally 77 %, test it if you like it, there could be so more rooms, so get it with a discount on steam and make your best out of it. Thanks for reading. P.S. i hope the developer still add "TRADING CARDS".

author: {'steamid': '76561198124770841', 'num_games_owned': 2744, 'num_reviews': 555, 'playtime_forever': 57, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 57, 'last_played': 1447834159}
review:
有点意思的恐怖游戏。可惜卡在某个解谜上了。明明看到一个和手上拿着的板块（就是这个游戏的logo？）相吻合的机关嘛，感觉应该能互动的，不然真的就没有其他地方能探索的了。
变种scp173的木偶模特（听他嘎吱嘎吱的声音其实应该是金属的），不过弱很多，既不能秒杀玩家，移动也不够快，最后还反被玩家弄死。
稍微特色点的应该是房间探索。每次要探索一个新房间，需要先找到一个该房间的模型，放到大厅的鸟瞰模型机关上衔接好，这样真实的房间才会出现。
这类基本无攻击，只能躲藏逃跑，第一人称动作冒险解密，自失忆症，逃生以来已经层出不穷。老实说，如果不带上耳机，吓不到我。其实比如fps也可以有很惊悚的游戏，mod游戏噩梦之屋2，个人感觉比格雷优秀，难度好上手，打的爽，惊悚程度也不低，剧情也有，而且免费，夫复何求？

author: {'steamid': '76561198086995968', 'num_games_owned': 1410, 'num_reviews': 151, 'playtime_forever': 87, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 87, 'last_played': 1446997218}
review:
I spook really easy where horror games are concerned. This game did not disappoint. It had my heart in my mouth in a few places....... :D The controls are simple, and the graphics are good. The dark bits are really dark, but you have a good-quality flashlight to help with those areas.

This game is currently listed at £4.79. This isn't too bad a price to pay for this game if you are looking for a bit of a scare. :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198254220295', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 36, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 34, 'last_played': 1673995974}
review: Absolutely terrifying! My feelings for this game is that of a love/hate relationship It's so good but so bad all at once! Especially for my heart... There's a few jump scares in there but honestly, the tension is probably the most frightening thing throughout most of the game. Whether you're unaware of what's next or already know what is to come, you still find your adrenaline pumping hella fast. There are two different endings which is also something I love in my games. If you're into horror with multiple endings and find dolls/mannequins creepy, this is a game definitely worth playing!

author: {'steamid': '76561197995382839', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 80, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 80, 'last_played': 1420585965}
review: Made by a team at my grad program. It's good, especially considering they developed it in like 6 months.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052247733', 'num_games_owned': 432, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 90, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 85, 'last_played': 1673907437}
review: This game is fantastic. It's fairly short, but the mechanics contained within that short time are very well-done and pretty unique. Scared the crap out of me multiple times and the puzzles are fairly intuitive, but still make you think a little, so it spares you some of the frustration many games of this type can cause you. Especially for the price, this is highly recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009943989', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 241, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 144, 'last_played': 1463950159}
review:
This is my review for Wes Kraven's Manor.

I got this game when I purchased the Humble Bundle so that I could get a copy of Stalker: Shadow of Chernobyl. I didn't really plan on playing any of the other games. However, Me and My Associate thought it would be a laugh to play Kravendales Manor. It looked like a Frictional game (The company that made Amnesia: The Dark Descent). 

I kind of feel deceiving for giving this a thumbs up. It was not the worst game I have ever played, however it did have a few low points. Some of the ideas were dank. The changeable room layout was a nice touch and gave you a lovely feeling of immersion. Plus, the graphics were pretty good for a cheap horror game. However the cheapness can be experienced in Kravat Manor.  The main antagonist "The Bronze Man" was poorly designed and shown way to many times for him to actually be scary, especially when his movement is shown to the player, which breaks all sense of fear as Talos' underdeveloped brother is slipping about the halls. Some of the animations were really bad and the last boss fight really took the feeling of the game and flipped turned it upside down. 

Overall, at its core, Kraken Manor is a cheap Amnesia clone with Slender stapled to its arse end. I would suggest giving this a shot if you wanted a short adventure game, not a scary spooky horror game. In the sea of cheap scary games, this could have differentiated itself if only it was a puzzle adventure game.  

Remember Dear Readers, You heard it here first. Off the Record, On the QT, and very Hush-Hush.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970314107', 'num_games_owned': 2304, 'num_reviews': 917, 'playtime_forever': 50, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 50, 'last_played': 1443682118}
review:
Amnesia certainly inspired a slew of imitators over the years, but few came out as polished as Kraven Manor. Originally a Guildhall student project, this one is a first-person romp through a spooky mansion with a creaky inhabitant and a cool gimmick for navigation. Once you start to dig into it, however, the polish starts to come off in some unfortunate ways. Part of that is in how the monster works, so if you're wary of spoilers you might want to skip this review.

The first thing you come across in the main hall of the manor is an incomplete model of the building. Throughout the game you find pieces of the model that you can fit as you please, freely rearranging the structure on the fly. It's a cool, simple gimmick that is used to unlock the final sequence... and that's it. You're not going to be doing much else in the manor, either. There's no inventory to fiddle with, only some books to get snippets from, items to lift and throw, and buttons to push.

What you are going to be doing is staring down the house's obnoxious bronze inhabitant. The enemy in Kraven Manor is one of those ever-popular Weeping Angel or SCP-173 types that only moves when you're not looking at it. I know that sounds kinda cool, but what that actually means is the moment you turn to work on a puzzle or leave the room, it caves your skull in. Sequences with the monster turn into aggravating games of Red Light, Red Light where you stare at it while trying to blind navigate to whatever the hell it was you were doing. And the thing goes all herky-jerky crazy when it's just out of your sight, resorting to straight-up teleporting if you're too good at keeping eye contact.

Easily the biggest knock against the game is its length. I beat it on Normal in just a little over 30 minutes. There's a Nightmare mode for masochists, because all it does is limit your flashlight and make the enemies kill you faster. If you're a jumpy type like me you'll get a few good rushes out of the enemy encounters and a few of the scripted moments, but it doesn't last. As a student project, Kraven Manor is undeniably impressive, but a paid product needs a lot more than what's offered here.

author: {'steamid': '76561198196444306', 'num_games_owned': 1155, 'num_reviews': 438, 'playtime_forever': 83, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 83, 'last_played': 1444068134}
review: The enemies behave like the weeping angels in the "Blink" episode of Doctor Who. They don't move while you're watching them. However, the manor is dark so you rely on your flashlight, which often fails in tense moments. Very atmospheric and clever horror game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198093220384', 'num_games_owned': 1651, 'num_reviews': 148, 'playtime_forever': 247, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 247, 'last_played': 1443536650}
review:
Kraven Manor was developed by a team of thirteen gradate students within a six month time frame. In some ways that fact is all too apparent, in other ways it's surprising just how much was accomplished with so little.

A first-person horror set within the eponymous building, the game's unique hook is that the structure of the whole manor can be changed dynamically. This is achieved by finding scale models of the individual rooms and setting them onto a board in the main hall, the arrangement of which determines what can be accessed. It's a really clever idea that lends itself well to an exciting scope of gameplay possibilities... or at least it could, it never really gets used to its full potential here. I think there were literally about two or maybe three instances in the whole game where the positioning of the rooms actually mattered in any significant way. Otherwise, the only thing it affected was the walking distance to the room you were heading to next.

I say "the whole game", there's isn't really all that much to it. There's maybe less than a dozen unique, relatively small areas to explore, all of which can be seen in probably about an hour for most players. But at least most of that time will be eventful as various set-pieces are triggered with regularity along the way, the vast majority of these being highly effective at unnerving the player. This is largely thanks to the main threat to your survival in the manor, a life-sized bronze mannequin that appears both lifeless and yet obsessive in its focus on your demise, made even more unsettling by its strange behaviour as it will only move and attack when not being looked at directly, otherwise perfectly playing its role of inanimate object.

So it has a solid idea at is core, a suitably terrifying creature stalking your progress and is well designed with its creepy locations and adequate visuals. But it's not without its issues. As I guess is to be expected given the nature of its birth, there are technical hiccups and bugs, several of which forced me to reload my game on more than a few occasions (sometimes not triggering an event necessary to progress, sometimes essential items couldn't be interacted with, and on a couple of instances closing the game and spitting me back out to Steam). Loading can also take a while, though in fairness, that's most likely due to the fact the rooms aren't in fixed locations, plus it only seems to load once at the start rather than room by room and is seamless thereafter. Movement also feels somewhat sluggish and cumbersome, though whether this is by design to add to the fear, or a result of poor programming is debatable.

Overall this ends up feeling like a very advanced prototype or proof of concept more than a fully-fledged game, and I really do hope it's developed further by the team into a greater experience. Despite its flaws, it really does have so much going for it well beyond a lot of other games in the genre made by more experienced people with more resources and hints at greater things to come for the young talents. So, if you're a fan of horror and have the patience and tolerance to see past its blemishes, then I think you'll be pleasantly surprised with Kraven Manor.

author: {'steamid': '76561198134420362', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 73, 'playtime_forever': 85, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 85, 'last_played': 1443172080}
review: A short horror game, but creepy and impressive. Recommend

author: {'steamid': '76561198013689732', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 125, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 125, 'last_played': 1442987295}
review:
As a project, it's okay.  As a game, it's simply lacking.
The bronze statue is a bare bones Slender Man stand-in (though it behaves just like the SCP statue) whom ceases to be threatening after the first few rooms and becomes laughable well before the end of the game.  The Unreal engine also causes objects to behave strangely, with wine bottles and glasses floating for no reason and being able to jump into/onto objects by holding something.  
It's a step above most attempts at horror on Steam, but frankly that's not saying much.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001427391', 'num_games_owned': 3386, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 131, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 131, 'last_played': 1442494390}
review: Un'avventura dalla brevissima durata che ci vedrà muoverci in una villa che cambia l'ordine delle stanze, in modo tale da risolvere i facilissimi enigmi volti a giungere alla fuga di questa abitazione infestata da fantasmi e da manichini che, quando non illuminati dalla nostra fidata torcia, si muoveranno alle nostre spalle con l'intento di ucciderci (il protagonista sarà inerme). Se l'avventura fosse stata più lunga avrebbe sicuramente meritato di più, ma a conti fatti è da prendere esclusivamente in qualche bundle o a pochissimo prezzo.

author: {'steamid': '76561197965383380', 'num_games_owned': 239, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 99, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 99, 'last_played': 1441468182}
review: It's like Amnesia, at first I thought they used the same engine and it's even made with the Amensia's level editor, but actually not, Amnesia uses HPL Engine 2 and Kraven Manor uses Unreal. The story is interesting, but it ends too quickly (around 2h), with this kind of story you could get a nice long game. The graphic style is beautiful and music fits to the atmosphere, especially I liked the last song after you enter to the lift. It's more like a tech demo than a game. I got this game from a bundle so every cent was worth it, I would even consider to buy it with 5 euros if I didn't already have it. But for 10e it's too short.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004389425', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 148, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 148, 'last_played': 1440887780}
review:
内容：マネキンと「だるまさんが転んだ」をするゲーム
感想：心臓ドッキリゲー、謎解きは子供でも解けるレベル（というより謎解きと言っていいレベルではない）
ボリューム：９０分程度かかりました
ストーリー：英語が難しく内容も複雑だったので、なんとなくしか理解できなかった

また、途中で先に進めないバグが発生しました。（再起動で解決　※なぜか前のチェックポイントからやり直させられた）

２０１５年８月３０日クリア時点で、重要そうなアイテムが数点余ったので
今後のアップデートで内容がボリュームアップするんじゃないかな？と妄想しました。

難易度によってエンディングが変化するという話も聞いたので、あらためてプレイした上でレビューで報告したいと思います

あくまで私見ですが
グラフィックやアニメーションは、はっきり言ってしょぼい。
ただ５００円のゲームとしては買いだと思います。

author: {'steamid': '76561198018893258', 'num_games_owned': 3719, 'num_reviews': 744, 'playtime_forever': 165, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 165, 'last_played': 1439326995}
review:
ホラーアドベンチャーゲーム。
怪しい実験が行われた屋敷に迷い込んだ主人公が脱出するのが目的。
低価格インディーゲームとは思えないグラフィックが綺麗なゲームだ。屋敷を探索して部屋の模型を探し出しメインホールの模型に連結することで、屋敷の構造がその模型の通りに変化し探索場所が増えていく。もちろん、通常のパズルやギミックなども存在する。難易度は2つでエンディングも2つとなっている。

[ブロンズ像]
主なホラー要素としては、特定箇所で出現する動くブロンズ像がある。懐中電灯の光を当てていれば動くことはないが、光を当ててないと攻撃してくる"だるまさんがころんだ"的なものになっている。距離を取るとワープしてくるので油断は禁物だ。音も無く迫ってくるブロンズ像が怖い。

[マップ模型]
1つの部屋の模型に2つの入り口があった場合、そのどちらかに連結を変えることができる。もちろん連結する入り口を変えることで、片方の入り口からはただの行き止まりでも、もう片方ではゲームが進展するようなイベントが起きたりすることもある。部屋同士を行き来きできるようにすることも可能だ。パズル的なマップ構造は試みとしては面白いが、部屋の種類が多くないこともあって連結させる組合せが少ないのが残念だ。

[マップと演出]
マップの作りこみが素晴らしく重厚な雰囲気を醸し出している。ホラー演出も非常に細かいところまで丁寧に作ってある印象だ。特に物音のタイミングが良く、動くブロンズ像の怖さを引き立てている。低価格ゲームとしては破格の完成度だと思う。

ホラーゲームという特性上リプレイ性はないが、初回プレイにおいての怖さは水準以上のものがある。多少の動作不安定さ、ボリュームの少なさはあるが、完成度としては十分すぎるほどでありホラーゲームを短時間で遊びたい場合に向いているゲームだと思う。

author: {'steamid': '76561198100994803', 'num_games_owned': 2325, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 642, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 424, 'last_played': 1508127037}
review:
Very short, but worth the money. Especially worth it if you catch it on sale or in a bundle (I got my copy in a bundle).

Basically, you explore the manor, solving fairly simple puzzles to advance to the next areas. The puzzles arent overly complicated, or much more than "find object A, carry to point B, advance to area C".

The sound sets a pretty foreboding atmosphere, but the lightning seems especially loud compared to other sounds. The lighting effects are also pretty nice, and the graphics are also pretty well done.

Controls are pretty basic. F for flashlight, E to use things, WASD to move, LShift to sprint. Theyre also customizable.

The main enemy of the game is a bronze statue that will show up every now and then or attack you. Something I thought was kind of cool, that you may miss, is when at the very start of the game, walk up the bronze guy and hit E. As you walk away (back pedal), after a lightning crack, he turns to face where you were. Was a nice creepy touch by the devs.

Either way, the game is short but well-done, and fairly creepy (it reminded me of Rose Red, the Stephen King miniseries). Its well worth the buy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005566986', 'num_games_owned': 1394, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 100, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 100, 'last_played': 1435569314}

author: {'steamid': '76561198078267201', 'num_games_owned': 362, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 204, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 204, 'last_played': 1435507028}
review:
You find yourself in Kraven Manor, a spooky and unsettling home to God only knows what. You don't particularly know the ins and outs of why you're there, nor do you know too much about the manor itself but you must press on in search of answers. There isn't much in the way of story or narrative here, the crumbs of story which you are fed are genrally found through interacting with old photographs and books that are strewn throughout each of the manor's creepy, harrowing halls and rooms. The gameplay is similar to other games of its kind; You are equipped with nothing but a flashlight and a journal which updates every so often after certain events occure. There are no weapons to speak of, running and keeping your wits about you are the only tools you'll need to survive. Exploration is the meat and bones of the game, whether you're looking for a key to open a locked door or a gear to fix a mechanism, you'll always be roaming room to room. 

Soon enough you'll come across the game's antagonist, a bronze statue that will terrorize you throughout certain sections of your journey through Kraven Manor. Keep your eyes on him and he's nothing more than any other creepy part of the manor's decor, but turn your back on him and you'll be terrofied by the loud, clanky footsteps that make their way toward you in the dark. It's a foe that will keep you on your toes throughout. One moment you'll be at ease and exploring, then the next you'll be fleeing in absolute horror as this metal abomination pursues you down darkened hallways. 

Arguably the biggest star of Kraven Manor is the manor itself. Dripping in atmosphere with rain splattering against the windows and thunder pounding through the halls, Kraven Manor seldom gives you any peace or moments rest. There were often times that I neglected some books and photographs, instead opting to get the hell out of whatever room I was occupying. 

Kraven Manor is  a short game, you'll probably finish up in an hour or maybe an hour and thirty depending on how thorougly you explore. 

If you're looking for a short, tense game to play one evening then it's a game you should definitely try. It may not do anything new and it never really strays away from established and tried mechanics, but Kraven Manor's bronze antagonist and gloomy setting are easily worth the price of admission.

author: {'steamid': '76561198134122159', 'num_games_owned': 337, 'num_reviews': 72, 'playtime_forever': 42, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 38, 'last_played': 1446405513}
review: Good Horror Game

author: {'steamid': '76561198003567915', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 61, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 61, 'last_played': 1434478236}
review:
[h1] Слендер попал в Амнезию	[/h1]

Визуально игра очень сильно напоминает Амнезию. Графика хорошая, также радует окружение. Атмосфера получилась прекрасной, идешь и слушаешь каждый шорох. Оно тоже очень напоминает Амнезию. Одним с больших плюсов игры есть поддержка русского языка, так же меня удивило наличие большого количества языков, там даже нашелся украинский, что достаточно редко бывает в компьютерных играх. Геймплей в игре хороший. Пугают нас качественными и отработанными приемами старой школы что тоже сегодня редкость. Звуки проработаны детально, и совпадают с действиями игрока. Хочу подвести итог, учитываято что игру делала независимая студия то она получилась просто шикарна. Им удалось сделать то что не всегда удается сделать большим студиям.

author: {'steamid': '76561198121364936', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 72, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 72, 'last_played': 1434300840}
review:
Buen juego indie de terror.

Tiene sus puntos buenos, como serían la ambientación, los sonidos que a veces te asustan más que los propios sustos o te mantienen en tensión, la historia y los gráficos del juego.

El único punto negativo sería algunos giros o movimientos de cámara, sobretodo en la parte final que (al menos para mi) eran algo mareantes, pero solo es la parte final.

En resumen, no es un juegazo pero pasar un buen rato con algún sustillo y tensión está bien.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011965365', 'num_games_owned': 2442, 'num_reviews': 2080, 'playtime_forever': 223, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 198, 'last_played': 1435653336}

author: {'steamid': '76561198158302387', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 178, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 174, 'last_played': 1437463893}
review: con una grafica a dir poco eccezionale e una ambientazione a dir poco terrificante kraven manor vi trasportera all interno di una villa non molto accogliente con all interno un manichino di bronzo che quando non guarderete vi ferira fino a uccidervi. enigmi non molto difficili accompagnati da un atmosfera di costante terrore rendono questo titolo spaventoso dall inizio alla fine con un finale inaspettato a mio parere.. tutto cio rendono questi 6 euro ben spesi

author: {'steamid': '76561198128998833', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 270, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 270, 'last_played': 1432853475}
review:
Kraven Manor is a title that I have to say I won't forget. It isn't by far the best game nor the worst but it is one of those games that has a little soul to it. The environment and sound are great, they will keep you on edge until you finish it. The story is very unique  and one of a kind if you ask me. I enjoyed it from start to finish and the secret ending gave me reason to make a second runthrough. It's a hidden gem that I was glad to have found and I'd recommend it for anyone who likes the creep-effect if you will. I suggest playing it on a rainy dim day, it happened that it worked out this way for me and it seemed to amp up the tension. The developer's are inspiring and are seemingly quick to give feedback. These are the kind of devs that deserve support. They earned mine and I think you'll agree if you visit the Manor. 

Final Verdict-7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198037929767', 'num_games_owned': 410, 'num_reviews': 79, 'playtime_forever': 58, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 58, 'last_played': 1431858126}
review:
If you like horror games, I recommend. 
I do not like horror games and I am completely a wuss when it comes to this sort of game.
That said, the atmosphere was SO GOOD that I couldn't play more than a few minutes. 
I got the first room, plopped it down, and couldn't figure out how to get into it by the time the tension had mounted too high for me to be able to keep playing.
SUCH atmosphere. SO scary. Wow.

I have no idea how this game has such low ratings unless these people just don't like being scared because this game is SO scary! And a cool idea! I wish I had the guts to play it. *shudder*

author: {'steamid': '76561198071381962', 'num_games_owned': 3847, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 86, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 86, 'last_played': 1429901947}
review:
I would recommend it even though I didn't like it that much because I can see other players would. 

pros:
- Great atmosphere can be very tense. 
- Enemy encounters are nicely done. The creature itself can be very creepy.
- good music matches with the settings. 
- never came across any bugs. 

cons:
- Because the way the enemy is set up it's easy to avoid death. If you get hit once you can just wait it out while you recharge your health. This however brings the whole game to a standstill and pulls you out from the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000315775', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 1474, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 663, 'last_played': 1449087801}
review:
No se puede negar que es una idea original. Fué muy buena idea preparar la mansión para que sea un gran espacio cuyas habitaciones son plataformas que se mueven y adaptan según tu voluntad. La historia del juego solo se entiende si lees los documentos que te vas encontrando y vas encajando las piezas por tu cuenta. No hay duda de que este juego podría haber llegado a ser algo realmente grande y magnífico, pero acabó siendo algo realmente cortito.

Los puntos negativos que le pongo al juego es que exige DEMASIADOS recursos del propio ordenador solo para lo que es en total el propio juego. Si tu ordenador no tiene gran potencia y velocidad, tarda más de uno o dos minutos en cargar la partida cuando sales del juego o te matan y necesitas cargarlo de nuevo ya sea desde el punto de control o desde el principio.

¿Mi recomendación? No lo compres, a menos que tengas un buen ordenador. Porque si no... puede resultarte muy frustrante jugarlo. Especialmente si eres de los que lo quieren todo al momento en un juego y/o si eres de los que no tienen ninguna tolerancia a la paciencia.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035616413', 'num_games_owned': 662, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 81, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 81, 'last_played': 1426622278}
review:
jeu court, mais très bien réalisé.

Les bons graphismes et le design retranscrivent des lieux sordides et peu éclairés, la marionnette sait vous tenir en haleine, pour un résultat capable de vous tenir aux tripes.

sans spoiler, pour faire tous les hauts fait vous allez devoir le recommencer, ce qui augmente sa durée de vie

heureusement, le prix est a la hauteur du temps de jeu, et il est souvent en promotion à 3 euros.

à ce prix je le recommande chaudement aux fan du survival horror.

author: {'steamid': '76561198070603328', 'num_games_owned': 2439, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 183, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 183, 'last_played': 1426122978}
review: I didn't enjoy this game but to be fair that's mainly because I don't like horror games :-) However one thing it gets right it the atmosphere. It's certainly very creepy and many moments made me jump. But there were annoyances too. The puzzles were not that difficult but they didn't really make sense, and neither did the story or the ending. Also the checkpoint saving tended to lock the game for a few seconds which broke the immersion. All in all I found it disappointing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198075430580', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 120, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 120, 'last_played': 1425906900}
review:
This game is a bullcrap, one of the stinkiest ones but with a bunch of good ideas.
The devs needs to learn how to make games that people enjoy and not that cause frustration.
Puzzles are way too easy, sounds are clunky (jeez, those bottle sounds) and the end (I think I was close to it but I gave it up): You are being chased by a mannekin-like monster when suddenly lights out, you are literally in the middle of nowhere, and don't see anything. But when I say anything, I mean ANYTHING AT ALL. You, in the dark without being able to use lintern for some reason. Don't even see if I am running or I am stuck facing a wall. Turn around and the same dark everywhere. Then I am caught and dead.
Are you serious? Is that what you mean or I am doing something wrong?
Devs think running/being stuck in the dark is a fun?
OK, just to say a positive part, I liked the idea mannekins attack you only if they are out of sight.
UPDATE:  I watched several walkthrus and this must be a bug in my case because I found no others with same issue. But yet, this game still appears to be an extremely flawed one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198169968582', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 95, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 95, 'last_played': 1423187582}
review:
6/10 - Good Game

Kraven manor is your typical first person psychological horror experience, it follows the same formula of most indie horror games, which include solving puzzles, out running a monster or 2, and blah blah. Its a relatively short game that can be beaten in an hour or 2. At its price of 6 dollars I'd say it just about makes the cut for being worth it's asking price. It's borderline mediocre, but it so happens to be just be above average to warrant a rating of "good". I also managed to get a few scares out of it, which i was pleased with. The monster you encounter is pretty creepy, so thats a plus too. There were 2 particular sections in the game i found to be impressive. 

If your a horror fiend like me and lookin to spend a few bones for a an hour or 2 of entertainment, you'll find it here if your expectations aren't too high

author: {'steamid': '76561198152415213', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 48, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 48, 'last_played': 1423426939}
review:

Печально.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040987377', 'num_games_owned': 3212, 'num_reviews': 79, 'playtime_forever': 58, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 58, 'last_played': 1423186739}
review:
[h1]Overview[/h1]
Kraven Manor is extremely short, and beatable in under one hour. The puzzles are easy, with the enemy evoking a good sense of fear, and there is a slight alternate ending that nets a few extra achievements. It’s horror in the atmospheric, psychological kind, but it’s not the “terror experience” that some people have claimed it to be.

[h1]TL:DR[/h1]
At its current price ($5.99 as of this review), it’s worth the purchase. I picked it up in a bundle myself many months back. At its full price, which I believe was $10 or just above, it would not be worth it, the value for your investment just wouldn’t be there.

[h1]The Good[/h1]
+ Graphics. For a bunch of university students, it looks good for the amount of time they’ve put into it. Being university students, you wouldn’t think they’d have a lot of free time for this. But, the game looks fantastic. The mansion is nicely dark and dank, and the animations and lighting are terrific.

+ Sound. The sound and music work wonderfully, from letting you know if the enemy is nearby to the feeling of something bad is about to happen when the music crescendos.

+ Atmosphere. It’s not a jump scare game, and that’s a good thing. Not knowing where the enemy is while you’re running around a darkened room looking for something, it evokes a sense of fear while not relying on crap jumping out of doors to frighten you.

[h1]The Bad[/h1]
- Length. This is extremely short. It’s almost more of a tech demo than an actual game, and you’ll be done in an hour, if that.

- Puzzles. They’re extremely easy. You will not need a walkthrough, or hints, or help of any kind.

- No replayability. For such a short game, that’s probably expected. There’s an alternate ending that really isn’t that good, that you can get by collecting three items during the normal play. There’s also a ‘Nightmare’ mode, which is slightly more difficult, but aside from an achievement for completing the harder mode, it’s all pretty much the same.

- Save stutter. For some reason, whenever the game autosaved, the game froze for a second or so. Which is odd. I’ve never had that happen in any games made in UE.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002686126', 'num_games_owned': 2426, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 95, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 95, 'last_played': 1423146443}
review:
Ich habe lange überlegt ob ich das Spiel empfehle. 
Im Endeffekt vor allem weil das Preis Leistungs-Verhältnis an der Grenze liegt. 

Schlussendlich muss ich sagen es ist ein Schönes spiel was ich empfehle, aber besser im Angebot. 

Das Spiel hat mankos und welche die erklär ich euch:

Das Hauptproblem: Die Spielzeit. Ich habe es jetzt in etwas über 1.5h durch, hab mir dabei zeit gelassen, bin auch einmal gestorben, denke mann kann es wenn man die Storyelemente ignoriert in unter einer Stunde durchspielen. Es hat leider auch nur einen Wiederspielwert wenn man das geheimlevel finden will sonst eher weniger. 

Die Story, ist kaum vorhanden. Du bekommst hier und da einen Hinweis über die bösen Taten des Herrn Kraven aber im Endeffekt ist der volle Storyinhalt des Spiels in einem Raum anderer Spiele vorhanden. man bekommt pro raum 2 bis 6 Zeilen infos über dies und das aber so richtig tief geht da ncihts und da wo du denkst es geht grad los, da endet der Spaß. 

Die Raumpositionierungsengin ist cool und echt hilfreich, geht aber zum Teufel. Wenn man mehr Räume hätte, noch mehr multiple Eingänge, komplexe ideen, dann könnte man richtig viel daraus machen, aber so wie das hier ist, ist es nur ein gimik welches zu schade zum programmieren ist so wie es hier zum tragen kommt.

Allerdings ein paar gute Worte zu dem Spiel:
Die Grafik ist wirklich gut und die Detailtreue die hier an den Tag gelegt wurde, findet man teils nicht einmal in AAA-titeln. Es sieht sich schön an und zusammen mit dem guten Sounddesign schafft es eine gute allgemeine Atmosphäre. 

Das Monsterdesign ist klasse. Du hast ab und zu unbeabsichtigte Jumpscares, die man nachvollziehen kann, man kann den gegner in Schach halten und muss nicht wie in anderen Spielen sinnlos in kauf nehmen dass der einen tötet oder der Spielcharakter einem den nerv raubt mit seinem Zähneknirschen. (Prinzipiell gefil mir die Idee mit der Taschenlampe schon bei Alone in the Dark) 

Alles in allem eigentlich ein schönes spiel dessen Inhalte aber auf die Länge vor die Hunde gehen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003878190', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 835, 'playtime_forever': 106, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 106, 'last_played': 1422866694}
review:
-: herná doba, bugy, občas nereagujúce hlavolamy a ich smiešna obtiažnosť, cena, žiaden dabing

+: grafika, atmosféra, efekty, príbeh, engine, dizajn, usadlosť, nepriatelia, finále, alternatívne zakončenie, sprístupňovanie izieb, hudba, slovenské titulky, poznámkový blok, strach, zábava

Verdikt: Kraven Manor je indie hororová hra s Nutella efektom. Obsahuje pasáže s bábkami, ktoré hráča vedia skutočne vydesiť. Po grafickej stránke hra vyzerá naozaj dobre a hudba pridáva na atmosfére. Koncept hry je založený na postupnom zbieraní modelov izieb a ich sprístupňovaní. V každej z miestnosti sa nachádzajú útržky príbehu a hlavolamy. Hlavolamy pôsobia v hre rušivo pre ich smiešnu obtiažnosť, ale to len do chvíle, kým vás niečo nezačne prenasledovať. Najväčším nepriateľom nie sú však figúrky, ale čas. Hra je naozaj krátka. Jej herná doba sa pohybuje okolo hodiny možno hodiny a pól. Kraven Manor je zaujímavá a zábavná hra, ale za hodinovú zábavu dať približne 6€ sa veľmi neoplatí. No ak chcete vidieť svoju partnerku sa báť a natáčať ju pritom...

66%

author: {'steamid': '76561198050634317', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 141, 'playtime_forever': 99, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 99, 'last_played': 1420930260}
review:
Než začnu kritizovat, předem řeknu jediné, je mnohem více horších her než Kraven Manor. Horších her, které se snaží svézt na vlně popularity a ukousnout kus toho koláče. O nic nového se nesnaží, ale jen špatně kopírují úspěšnou hru. Zpátky ke hře.

Tolik vyzdvihované stavění místnosti je naprosto k smíchu, to už si je tam vývojáři fakt mohli dát sami, a těch pár kliknutí si odpustit (byť nápad není špatný, ale je blbě proveden, ostatně jako snad vše v této hře). Hádanky jsou zde zřejmě jenom proto, aby mohli být v popisu hry. Hra se od freeware verze moc neliší, má krátkou herní dobu (naštěstí?), HW nároky jsou vyšší, nulová interakce a hororovost...
Na druhou stranu se na to vše nekouká vůbec zle. Grafika není špatná, a tak zamrzí, že se vlastně není moc na co dívat. Všude samé zavřené dveře, lokace nevyužité, prkenné AI nepřátel (zase - nápad je dobrý, ale pak nefunguje. Jde o to, že když svítíte na "nepřítele", tak se nepohybuje, sotva ho ztratíte z očí, jde vám po krku. Zdravíme Dr. Who!). Později se však světla už nebojí a jdou jen tupě po vás. Safra, to jsou zase negativa. Hra holt jiné klady nemá.

Hra údajně sice má alternativní konec (jedno odlišné zakončení videem) a skrytou tajnou místnost, ale to bych musel hru hrát znova, a na to jsem neměl ani pomyšlení. A znova trajdat po zámku [strike]hrůzy[/strike] NUDY nehodlám.
Škoda, určitý potenciál hra měla. Jsem si jistý, kdyby autoři přidali obsah do původní verze zdarma, lidi by neměli námitky. Takhle se ale nenechte zmást pozlátkem, jak hra na první pohled vypadá a představuje se.
Být na Steamu ta freeware verze, mohu doporučit, jelikož jako projekt studentů byla hra nadějná. Takhle uděláte lépe, sáhnete-li po jedné z lepších modifikací do Amnesie The Dark Descent. Jsou delší, mají lepší příběh, hádanky a prostředí (nejen hradu).
BTW: Hra není v češtině jak se uvádí, ale ve slovenštině.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993681861', 'num_games_owned': 2141, 'num_reviews': 181, 'playtime_forever': 167, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 167, 'last_played': 1420132726}
review:
This is an indie gem and please do not get repulsed by a mixed vox populi. 

Firstly, this game is super short. I have finished my first playthrough in about 1.5 h taking my time to read all notes and paying attention to details. My second playthrough in which I aimed to get to the alternative ending took me about.. 27 minutes... the plot is simple but engaging, there are scary moments, but enough to remain scary, not frustratingly repetitive. The atmosphere of the old manor is felt and the graphics are surprisingly good conidering this is an indie title made by students (as far as I know). 

However what makes this game unique is the concept of dynamically creating the environment around you, which certainly should be developed into future, more complex project. 

Consider this game as an indie with a lot of potential to become a successful aaa if developed with proper amount of money and resources. 

This game if deffo worth getting on sale r in the bundle. You will not be disappointed. 

Also, I would recommend to all Cube (the movie) fans.. for a valid reason :)

7/10 = a solid short indie title, with nice concept and neat graphics

author: {'steamid': '76561198031651888', 'num_games_owned': 801, 'num_reviews': 441, 'playtime_forever': 128, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 128, 'last_played': 1419685051}
review:
Il pleut des cordes et vous trouvez refuge dans un lugubre manoir. Vous n'en saurez pas plus sur le pourquoi du comment. A vous d'explorer le terrifiant manoir de Kraven. Portes qui se ferment toutes seules, tremblements, fantômes, mannequins qui vous veulent du mal : ce jeu fait PEUR ! (ok, je suis une petite nature). C'est une exploration qui doit valoir son pesant de pilules antistress avec l'Oculus Rift (j'ai hâte d'avoir ce bidule).

Ce jeu a été créé par des étudiants pour un projet scolaire, ce qui est impressionnant vu la qualité technique. Les graphismes et effets sonores contribuent fortement à l'atmosphère angoissante de ce jeu. J'ai réellement pris peur par moments 

A part ça, le jeu est très linéaire, court et facile. En fait, il n'y a aucun réel puzzle. On n'est pas dans "the 7h Guest".
Certains aspects sont même ratés, comme les objets qui semblent tous être en caoutchouc (quand on lance une bouteille, elle va rebondir mollement).
L'idée de pouvoir constituer soi même l'emplacement des pièces du manoir est sympathique.

Mais, ça manque tout de même de challenge. Je ne l'aurais pas acheté si je ne l'avais pas eu dans un Bundle.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022820771', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 155, 'playtime_forever': 83, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 83, 'last_played': 1419385784}
review:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RvaVsU-mt5A

	Kraven Manor is a horror/ adventure game with a few puzzles thrown in.  
The story is sparse, and the graphics are passable.  The music does a good job 
of conveying an atmosphere of horror.  

	Your goal in the game is to escape the manor alive.  To make up for a 
sparing plot with little backstory, the game excells in its level design.  You will
feel spooked by the creepy atmosphere; it lures you into wanting to survive, to 
escape in one piece.  

	The game isn't all that long, but worth a few bucks.  The sense of immersion
alone makes it worth it.  

This is a summary of my review video, which I encourage you to watch if you are looking for a more in-depth review.

Thanks for your viewership and support; for more videos click here:
http:/www.youtube.com/user/SocioPyscho

author: {'steamid': '76561198068329619', 'num_games_owned': 717, 'num_reviews': 357, 'playtime_forever': 51, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15, 'last_played': 1422580763}
review:
Kraven Manor.

The best way to describe this game is: "It looks good on paper, but in execution it missed"

This is a pyschological horror game. You will feel, the same feels that you felt from other games just like this one. It's puzzles are easy and the game isn't really that long. The atomsphere while creepy, and haunting it really just isn't enough from every now and then they will give that "jump scare" moment in the game but of course it's the standard horror movie: stuff falls, power goes out, your in a "Hell" situation, is something behind me? dark, creepy sections of the game. The usual

The developers really had something going here. But they missed their mark. If you want to try games like this. Best you avoid this one

author: {'steamid': '76561198026917831', 'num_games_owned': 326, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 91, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 91, 'last_played': 1419281867}

author: {'steamid': '76561198020833183', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 95, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 95, 'last_played': 1418946069}
review:
If you're looking for a challenging game, this is not it. Encounters are very tense but quickly becomes easy to handle. It's worth a try if you enjoy making others play the game and watch their reactions but other than that, there's not much to go back to after finishing the game.

Overall good game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001527683', 'num_games_owned': 668, 'num_reviews': 104, 'playtime_forever': 145, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 145, 'last_played': 1419103416}
review:
Juego original, con mecanicas interesantes y buenas ideas, un maniquí muy inquietante y unos niveles bien diseñados. Puzzles sencillos y es ir avanzando y buscando ciertos objetos. Interesante y vale la pena peeeeero es MUY corto. En mis 2 horas y media de juego me lo he pasado dos veces (para ver el final secreto más que nada) . Recomendado jugarlo en la dificultad máxima ya que en la normal pierde mucha tensión ya que la linterna es infinita.

Es una pena que sea tan corto porque tiene muy buenos conceptos que podrían haberse explotado muchísimo más para hacer un gran juego y trama, la cual deja con ganas de saber más cosas ya que no se dá demasiada información y es más trabajo de como lo interpretes tu. El tema de ir consiguiendo las habitaciones podría haberse alargado muchisimo y acerse muy interesante. 

Lo recomiendo si lo pillais bien baratito de oferta (yo lo conseguí de gratis con las subastas xD) porque es buen juego y con buenas ideas pero extremadamente corto.  Si buscais un juego largo, con trama compleja y con mucha interacción, este no es el juego adecuado. Si buscais algo más directo, sencillo pero entretenido y bastante tenso, este juego os gustará pero os dejará con ganas de más.

author: {'steamid': '76561198080492435', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 51, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 51, 'last_played': 1418595472}

author: {'steamid': '76561198004212697', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 317, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 253, 'last_played': 1418739484}
review:
Kraven Manor é um jogo terror com puzzles.

A arte é boa, caracterízando mansões abandonadas, as animações quase não existem no jogo. A mecânica é simples não tem nada de inovador, o que o jogador precisa fazer é encontrar itens e montá-los nos lugares certos, você pode andar, correr, pegar itens, ligar e desligar uma lanterna e arremessá-los, a dificuldade é baixa, os puzzles são muito simples, o jogo é bem curto, os efeitos e trilha sonora do jogo é simples porém cria uma pequena tensão no jogo, os objetos de livros e páginas que servem para contar a história do jogo não contam a história completa, é possível ligar muitas coisas e fatos, mas mesmo assim ainda fica faltando uma boa parte da explicação.

No jogo existem alguns bugs de renderização do cenário, os loads são demorados, mas o pior de tudo são os crashs do save game e os problemas no UDK que surgem quando você menos espera e fecha o jogo. As vezes quando você morre e vai recomeçar o o jogo novamente surge um problema de UDK e fecha o jogo e quando isso acontece há 70% do seu save game ter sido corrompido e você ter que iniciar tudo de novo, e durante o jogo quando aparecer a indicação de salvando o jogo evite apertar qualquer botão, pois, as vezes isso pode causar algum problema no UDK e  corromper seu save game, esses bugs e problema no UDK que surgem comprometem o jogo inteiro e te faz passar muita raiva.

O jogo em sí não apresenta nada de mais, porém acho que o jogo está muito caro pra quem tem cerca de uma hora e meia de duração, puzzles simples, história incompleta e graves erros com os save games. Se não quer ter decepções ou passar raiva passa longe desse jogo, é mais válido ler a história em algum site, que por sinal também é bem curta e ver os finais no youtube do que ter essa experiência no jogo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046720408', 'num_games_owned': 2658, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 399, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 323, 'last_played': 1512089906}
review:
I've played through most of the game so far. I'm currently at the final boss. I must say, I love the idea of building a model of the house in order to reach more locations! For the time played, the game was very enjoyable. 

I do wish it were longer though and hopefuly we'll see something similar to this on a much bigger scale in the future! A lot can be done with building the world around you in a horror game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055656538', 'num_games_owned': 5025, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 184, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 184, 'last_played': 1418412429}
review: Шикарный прототип - вот, как можно охарактеризовать эту игру, главной особенностью которой является самостоятельная планировка помещений в особняке и да это хоррор со скримерами. Идея восхитительная - на столе лежат образцы комнат с одной или несколькими дверьми, ваша задача эти комнаты стыковать с главным залом и между собой для получения необходимого расположения дверей и проходов. После чего отправляешься в нужное место - выполняешь простенький квест - получаешь макет новой комнаты или вещь - стыкуешь комнаты по-другому. Все бы хорошо, но реиграбельность сего действа нулевая. Обе концовки, если знаешь что делать, можно получить за одно прохождение, завершив игру в "лоб" и впоследствии загрузив сейв - пройти последний чекпоинт иначе. А вообще игра проходится минут за 40, что, несомненно, явилось бы плюсом, будучи в игре хоть какая-то реиграбельность но, увы таковой нет. Атмосфера, дизайн помещений и звуковое сопровождение на достойном уровне. Во время игры посещала мысль о том, что разработчики были идейно вдохновлены такими старыми квестами, как Дракула и Мист. Графическая составляющая оставляет желать лучшего, но не является отталкивающим фактором, ибо основную часть времени придется проводить в темных помещениях с тусклым свечным освещением, или вовсе без оного – вооружившись фанариком. Именно к фанарику, т.е. садятся в нем батарейки или нет, привязана сложность игры. Говоря о сюжете, который укладывается в одно предложение, притом, что во всех помещения разбросаны отсылки, подсказки и фотографии, он не плох, но слишком банален и прост. Несмотря на все недостатки, советую пройти игру.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995892659', 'num_games_owned': 2468, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 121, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 121, 'last_played': 1418128937}
review: A survival horror game much in the style of Amnesia: The Dark Descent, although somewhat lower budget - it has no voice acting and can be beaten in less than two hours. It is decent if someone likes this sort of thing, but do not pay too much for it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198062269122', 'num_games_owned': 1154, 'num_reviews': 290, 'playtime_forever': 419, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 419, 'last_played': 1417849395}
review:
Le doy a "Kraven Manor" la medalla de plata por ser el segundo juego que más veces me ha hecho reiniar el ordenador. Al margen de esto, ¿de qué va "Kraven Manor"? Pues ni idea, pero supongo que lo típico. Entras porque sí en una mansión misteriosa y te pones a corretear por ella. El diseño de la mansión me gusta, aunque es pequeña, y eso hace que el juego sea corto. Para empezar, cuando comenzamos la partida, casi no podemos movernos por la mansión hasta que encontramos una maqueta de una zona de la mansión, la cual tendremos que llevar a una gran mesa en el vestíbulo de la misma y acoplarla puerta con puerta a una maqueta del vestíbulo. En ese momento escuchas un ruido y la puerta donde hayas encajado la maqueta se desbloqueará. Entonces te das cuenta que las puertas de la mansión se van abriendo y cerrando según encajes las maquetas que vas encontrando en tu deambular por el juego. Para que te hagas una idea, las habitaciones son como un cubo de Rubik y se reordenan conforme lo hagas tú con las maquetas. A mí me gustó esta mecánica, pero yo es que soy muy facilón.
Explorando por ahí no lucharemos con nadie. Lo más parecido será escapar dos o tres veces de unos maniquís de bronce que nos persiguen y no dan miedo ninguno, así que entre que el juego es corto, la mansión pequeña y que casi todo el juego es un paseo, "Kraven Manor" se queda en una anécdota, y es una pena, porque me esperaba más de un juego que tenía pinta de ir al grano: mansión chunga, linterna y ponte a explorar.
En la parte técnica, el juego necesita demasiados recursos para lo que es, y mi ordenador sudaba la gota gorda para moverlo. Dos cuelgues más y me hubiera terminado Don Quijote de la Mancha.
Para los que sólo se leen la última frase: no pagues más de 1 euro por él. Idea buena, pero desarrollo flojo.

[b]Entonces, ¿de qué va el juego?[/b] De explorar. Lograr abrir puertas cerradas y todo ese rollo.
[b]Con estos juegos me agobio. ¿Es complicado?[/b] No. Es bastante fácil.
[b]¿Qué juego tiene la medalla de oro?[/b] El "STALKER: Shadow of Chernobyl". Me petó hasta la tarjeta gráfica.

author: {'steamid': '76561198078093594', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 348, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 348, 'last_played': 1417645773}
review:
Kraven Manor no es el mejor juego de terror jamás visto, pero es un juego de terror muy decente. Del estilo de Penumbra o Amnesia pero con menos interacción todavía, el juego tampoco necesita que el personaje se esconda por tanto no tiene opción de agacharse (¿extraño? Puede ser, pero cuando juegues es mejor permanecer al descubierto y alumbrar bien con la linterna, ya descubrirás por qué). La interacción con objetos también es escasa, pero deja lo justo para avanzar en la historia y creeme, nada más empezar puede ser que digas..."pues vaya". Pero no te da tiempo lamentar nada, además el hecho de no utilizar casi nada aumenta la tensión. La historia a simple vista es muy sencilla, te vas enterando de lo sucedido (sacando tus propias conclusiones) por fotografias, recortes de periodicos o libros con muy pocas palabras, una pequeña frase en cada una.

Kraven Manor, gana realmente en el apartado sonoro y visual, visualmente se ve muy bien, tiene gran detalle y los efectos sonoros son muy intensos, te sacarán varios saltos de la silla, si estás con los cascos y a oscuras. Los enemigos del juego, para mi han sido todo un acierto, personalmente lo he visto casi todo, pero cada vez que veo este "tipo" de enemigo, dentro de mi se retuerce algo extraño que me inquieta y eso hizo que disfrutara mucho del juego, hubo momentos que dudé en seguir (pero esto es personal, porque como he dicho, me da mucha cosilla ese tipo de enemigo).

El juego dura tan solo entre 1 hora y media a 2 horas y poco. Tiene posibilidad de rejugarlo para conseguir ciertos objetos, que en mi primera pasada, no tengo ni idea de donde podrían estar. 
Kraven Manor te mantiene en tensión practicamente al empezar, pero a partir del Climax final esa emoción baja un poco (puede ser por el cambio de sonido que no le pega mucho o porque a lo mejor me esperaba algo más). En fín, la idea principal me ha gustado bastante, ¿a lo mejor con un poco más de argumento y duración, habría cambiado la cosa a mejor? ¿o a peor?... no se, personalmente me lo he pasado muy bien lo poco que ha durado, al final un poco frio, con ganas de más, pero bien. 

Para mi, el puntazo, los malditos enemigos con sus siniestro sonidos y posturas. Lo peor, no aprovechar la mansión lo suficiente, esto habría dado mucho juego.

Si está en oferta es una compra recomendable.

author: {'steamid': '76561197973051072', 'num_games_owned': 1017, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 78, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 78, 'last_played': 1417355687}

author: {'steamid': '76561198017381248', 'num_games_owned': 1611, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 152, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 152, 'last_played': 1412264656}
review:
Its got all the elements of a modern horro game except one. It has events outside your control, jumpscares, things changing position when you turn away, mandatory puzzle-solving, and a lovable creepy assailant. What it lacks is length, its easily less than 2 hours if there aren't any show-stopping bugs (only saw one - a medallion thar didn't slot into place) for normal, no clue about the tougher difficulty.

If I recall there are two configurable difficulty levels, and I assume the tougher one allows for access to slightly more content, which may make more content accessible with the added challenge (which would make sense because there were some moving parts I couldn't complete on normal).

The one knock I have with the gameplay content is the chase sequence towards the end. Repetitiously running through an I'm-being-chased maze til completing it isn't spooky or scary, its kinda lame and boring. Okay maybe two knocks - ZERO explanation as to why the character ended up in there, who they are, or anything else, so I really have zero connection to the avatar I'm controlling and feel no empathy for it. Other than that, there wasn't much in the way of psychological horror, mostly jumpscares. I have a natural +10 resistance with saving throws against jumpscares, I just laugh at them. :)

That being said, its great for a student project, and definitely has all the atmosphere and elements of a modern horror game. Thumbs up.

author: {'steamid': '76561198084285016', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 47, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 47, 'last_played': 1414912326}
review: Great game! Scary but it ends quickly. If they were to add more for the price of the game it would be a great game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996678922', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 232, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 232, 'last_played': 1414880552}
review:
This is a really well done, VERY short game with relatively little replay value... it would be a rental if such things still existed. I would reccomend purchasing it on sale.

What it does, it does very well. The game is creepy, well orchestrated, has some neat lay-out mechanics, and gives a nice feeling of unease throughout the story... the problem is that there just isn't much story. There's no intro or reason why you're in the manor in the first place... no investigation is mentioned, and the clues to the tale are scattered minimally throughout the game.

The antagonist is effectively creepy until you figure out the mechanic behind the attacks and how to stay safe... and at that point, the game suddenly begins to feel like a rail haunted house ride. You're there to experience a mostly linear story, and you can do it in relative safety. It just doesn't feel like it at first.

If I knew there would be more game added on to what's already here, I'd recommend it at full price. As is, its just really far too short.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001502765', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 67, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 67, 'last_played': 1414228492}

author: {'steamid': '76561198043609914', 'num_games_owned': 3556, 'num_reviews': 834, 'playtime_forever': 74, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 74, 'last_played': 1413473203}
review: Kraven Manor is the full game based on the demo that was available for free for some time now. But now that the full game has come to steam will you want to play it ? In Kraven Manor you play as a unknow guy who enters Kraven Manor. Once you get there you start to find out deep and twisted stuff about the manor. Which i will not spoil here because its more spoiler territory. Overall how is Kravens Manor ? Its not good in any way. Right off the bat i have to say something about the demo too. The game barely added anything that wasnt in the demo. Only a few improvements and a new level. The game is still incredibly short just barely an hour long. The game does look great for an indie and the enviroment is outstanding so  is the atmosphere. But where does the game go wrong ? Well everywhere else. The game has incredibly stupid puzzles and not to mention dealing with the monster is also stupid. It does play like a fast paced amnesia but thats about it, Pros: The game looks great and plays great too. Oustanding atmosphere. Cons:  Stupid puzzles, Annoying enemies, incredibly short and anti climatic ending, Overall get Kraven Manor only when its on sale otherwise just skip this. I give Kraven Manor a 5.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197974002194', 'num_games_owned': 1646, 'num_reviews': 237, 'playtime_forever': 43, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 43, 'last_played': 1412182490}
review:
Réalisation très propre. Ce jeu a été développé par un étudiant qui a remporté un concours avec. À la suite de quoi, il a étoffé le contenu et l'a publié sur Steam. Certains joueurs pestent car la version initiale - non améliorée - était gratuite. Ici, la durée de vie est un peu courte pour 10€.

Il peut faire peur, mais plutôt comme Machine for Pigs et non Amnesia original. L'atmosphère est très bien installée. Agréable, précisément adapté à ceux qui ne sont pas fan du genre "horreur" mais qui aimeraient quand même avoir quelques frissons (pour cet Halloween par exemple).

author: {'steamid': '76561198015956371', 'num_games_owned': 1392, 'num_reviews': 129, 'playtime_forever': 130, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 130, 'last_played': 1671694162}
review:
Recomendo este jogo apenas para quem é fã do gênero.

+ Enredo
+ Ótimos gráficos (Lembra muito Amnésia)
+ Boa Programação
+ Trilha Sonora 
+ Ambientação (Que também lembra Amnésia)

- Bug Gear
- Curta duração (O jogo termina em 1 - 2 horas de gameplay)
- Alto preço para um jogo de curtissíma duração

author: {'steamid': '76561197970842475', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 68, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 68, 'last_played': 1412577875}
review: Let me start by saying this is a good game. Better than a vast majority of the indie crap that's out there. The graphics are great, the game mechanics are sound,  it's a game that had an obvious amount of love invested in it. The reason I don't recommend this game is that it is terribly short experience with a threadbare story and few real action pieces. The game isn't an experience in terror, like some would claim, but felt more like a teaser to a much bigger game. I'd say this was more a $5 game than $10. Even so, if you've got money to burn and an hour to kill, go ahead and give it a go.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013536450', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 108, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 91, 'last_played': 1413503470}
review: Building the map as you play, It's an interesting idea, however, that mechanic gets taken away quickly as you need to position the rooms in a certain order to finish the game. Which only lasts about an hour, and at £6.99, that just isn't enough. There are a few jumpscares but the game lost all tension for me after the antagonist got stuck in a tiny box on the floor.

author: {'steamid': '76561198066821478', 'num_games_owned': 391, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 273, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 222, 'last_played': 1601948882}

author: {'steamid': '76561198034500971', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 140, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 140, 'last_played': 1413057024}
review:
Kraven Manor est un excellent jeu offrant une ambiance pafaitement travaillée !
Âmes sensibles s'abstenir, KM se veut flippant, et pour moi c'est une réussite !
Le seul défaut de KM est sa durée de vie, qui est un peu courte, mais on tolère tout de même ce défaut car durant les quelques heures de jeu, on ne s'ennuie pas !
Finalement Kraven Manor ressemble fort à Outlast et Daylight, cette ressemblace touche surtout l'ambiance.
Si vous avez aimé Outlast ou Daylight, ne vous privez pas de Kraven Manor !

author: {'steamid': '76561197996734464', 'num_games_owned': 1587, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 116, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 116, 'last_played': 1412370043}
review: Un horror piuttosto fiacco. Magari, se amate il genere, prendetelo in periodo di saldi.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995044455', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 95, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 95, 'last_played': 1412257873}
review: S'il y a une chose sur laquelle les joueurs seront d'accord, c'est que Kraven Manor aurait gagné à être plus long. Cela trahit donc qu'il est loin d'être mauvais. Et pour cause, c'est un petit jeu d'horreur très plaisant. Graphiquement, il est selon moi, très beau, l'ambiance sonore est très agréable (hormis quelques détails qui sonnent parfois étrangement), et l'atmosphère du jeu reste angoissante. Angoissante cependant, pas terrifiante car le jeu est trop court pour que l'on s'en imprègne réellement. L'idée de la maquette du manoir est également innovante et intéressante (bien que pas totalement exploitée à mon goût). L'histoire n'est pas mauvaise non plus (mais pas exceptionnelle, j'en conviens). Alors certes, il est peut être un peu cher pour sa durée de jeu (1h tout au plus) mais il ne faut pas oublier qu'il a été à la base, créé par des étudiants. Et selon moi, ils méritent bien une rémunération pour cette expérience!

author: {'steamid': '76561198033530860', 'num_games_owned': 212, 'num_reviews': 97, 'playtime_forever': 1224, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 692, 'last_played': 1429194366}

author: {'steamid': '76561197985717367', 'num_games_owned': 910, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 139, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 139, 'last_played': 1412165491}
review:
Un jeu extrèmement court, sans difficulté, il ne fait aucunement peur ou joue juste sur l'effet de surprise mais trop peut souvent.
C'est bien dommage car le titre est propre graphiquement, une atmosphère sombre assez bien rendu, gestion de la recharge de la lampe en mode cauchemar.

Trop chère pour le temps passé dessus, à prendre sur une très grosse promo à la limite autrement passé votre chemin on trouve mieux ailleurs.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001301431', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 135, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 124, 'last_played': 1412057180}
review:
Great horror game. If you expect a lot of jumpscares i am going to disappoint you. There are moments that Kraven Manor will scare you and make you cry but these are few throughout the whole game. What makes this game an absolute must have in your library is the dark and creepy atmosphere and the general feeling that there is someone, something behind you the whole time. A very beautiful game with gorgeous graphics that will make you forget it's an indie one.
The mechanic that allows you to interact with miniature rooms in order to gain entrance to the same rooms in the manor is innovative and brings a fresh breath to the genre.
Puzzles are not very hard to solve but neither too easy to think the game is failing. The only negative aspect of the game is the fact that is short. It will take you 50 mins - 1 hour max to finish. The great ending though will make you forget about that very fast. You should buy Kraven Manor if you are looking for a true horror experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054142896', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 90, 'playtime_forever': 47, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 47, 'last_played': 1412097900}

author: {'steamid': '76561198055960747', 'num_games_owned': 661, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 41, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 41, 'last_played': 1412017496}
review:
Also als Fazit muss ich sagen: knapp 10 euro für 30min "spielspaß" echt zu viel. Als ich das Spiel vor einer Weile bei Markiplier sah, ging ich davon aus, dass es sich um eine Betaversion handelt. Das tat es nicht! Fade Rätsel gepaart mit einem immer wiederkehrenden Puppenmonster, welches nicht wirklich Schrecken erzeugt, gespickt mit einer flachen. Sorry, für ein free to play ok, aber jetzt ärgere ich mich ein wenig, dass ich Geld dafür zahlte.

Mfg

author: {'steamid': '76561197970056305', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 55, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 55, 'last_played': 1412012959}
review:
Thumbs up to this awesome piece of gaming history. At first I thought the game was going to be like many other indie horrors I've played in the past but after 45 minutes in I had this insatiable urge to worship the Devil. Now I have lots of friends!

Sure, the blood sacrafices can get a little messy at times, but you sure can't pass up that dip that my friend Carl makes for the occassion. I mean it's to die for, really.  It's a shame he doesn't game otherwise I'd show him this game, I'm pretty sure he'd love it.  But not as much as he loves the Devil.

Thanks for helping me realize my love of the dark lord Kraven Manor! A+ would play again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048974498', 'num_games_owned': 2973, 'num_reviews': 812, 'playtime_forever': 272, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 272, 'last_played': 1420130985}
review:
Now, this is one game almost solely dedicated to the notion of SPOOKY.   The other recurring theme is MODELS:  No, not the wafer-thin things that caper about on cat-walks, but rather a three-dimensional model of the title building and its attendant rooms/sections (an absolutely ingenious device which you'll just have to play the game to "spoil" for yourself), as well as some of the hands-down scariest bronze statues/art models you will ever have the good fortune to be terrorized by.  

   I gotta say, it's always nice to be so pleasantly surprised by a game you didn't even know existed until it was already available in the Steam store (the last such game for yours truly was perhaps Outlast, so this title is in mighty good company therein). This isn't to say there aren't a few problems, however...

   Firstly, the Steam asking price is a tad silly for a game which even I managed to complete in under two hours ('cause believe me, I play games kinda sloooooow).  The project is apparently the product of university students graduating from a game design course, so within those parameters it's impressive as hell, but it doesn't hurt to recognise that even the very best of such projects can't exactly go head-to-head with the "big boys", especially price-wise.  

   Secondly, there's a few glitches...on more than one occasion, I had a particular enemy permanently freeze on me; which might almost sound like a "good"/opportunistic thing, but decidedly less so when you require said enemy to cause damage to something in order for you to progress.  

   Also, I had a hell of a time getting a couple of objects to successfully interact with what they were SUPPOSED to interact with.  I especially had no end of fun trying to get a round ornamental medal thing to go into its appropriate slot in a wall...thought I must be missing something...looked up a video walkthrough and lo and behold, the dude playing it gets it in first go without even trying.  One game reboot later and I finally managed it, but again not quite as promptly as Mr Walkthrough did, so...yes, problems, it had a few.  I did however break with my usual cheapskate tradition (of waiting for a decent sale) and bought this game smack-dab on its release date, so perhaps these little bugs will be corrected with time...

   On the whole, though...VERY impressed.  Expect big, big things from the people involved.  For now, this one merely qualifies as just a single "big", but there's no doubt there's some talent involved here.  If I were their teacher, I would definitely give them an "A" (but not quite an "A+")...but since I'm not a teacher, I'll simply rate them in my standard manor (whoops, make that "manner"), and round off my review with the customary:

Verdict: 8.5/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198131841383', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 49, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 49, 'last_played': 1411746675}
review:
It definitely is a solid game, but i have to make some minor deductions. :)

+ graphics (nicely textured and good use of particle effects)
+ music and background noises
+ good use of Unreal Engine features

- some sounds were a bit strange
- the game is pretty short ( finished it in 50 minutes, so I guess normal players will play like 1 hour or so)
- no real use of skeletal meshes and animations

++ The ending was very well done and made me like the game anyway :) So i'd recommend it!

author: {'steamid': '76561197960385340', 'num_games_owned': 592, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 158, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 158, 'last_played': 1411829277}
review:
I just finished the game so far as i came in the demo version and im quite pumped to whats gonna happen to me now.

Its really interesting so far and it seems im quite attractive in the world of female bronze statues as they go after me whenever they can.

To me it feels a little smoother than the free version which is good, but there are still no real options available, Resolution, Detail, AA, FPS cap (which can be set to unlimited!).

For now i didnt encounter any flaws/bugs or whatever, so i would recommend it, and even if you do, for 9/10 $/€ its feels very solid.

So, enough writing, NEED...TO...PLAY...NOW

edit: i just finished the game...

i went afk for a while and i got a total of 50 minutes gameplay recorded and i read almost everything as well

Hmm thats a bit to short for my taste, maybe they'll add more? Who knows
